info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 2:06PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Rock Island, western Whiteside, northwestern Henry, Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 206 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Erie to Rock Island. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Port Byron and Riverdale around 215 PM CDT. Erie around 220 PM CDT. Walcott around 225 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Davenport, Cordova, Eldridge, Camanche, Garden Plain, Albany, Clinton, Fulton, Long Grove, Donahue, Low Moor and East Clinton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 284 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 22. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
